metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2201 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In generate_jsimd_ycc_rgb_convert_neon of jsimd_arm64_neon.S, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution in an unprivileged process with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9 Android-10Android ID: A-120551338

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.3
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.3
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.3
libturbojpeg - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu3.3').
